repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
Unable to get script location in .nvim.lua using `debug.info(...)`.

Solution:
Provide the filename as `chunkname` argument to `loadstring()`.

Fixes: #34577

comment_data.body:
`loadstring()` accepts a `chunkname` argument too so this could just be

```suggestion
            assert(loadstring(trusted, '@' .. file))()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -952,7 +952,8 @@ do
         local trusted = vim.secure.read(file) --[[@as string|nil]]
         if trusted then
           if vim.endswith(file, '.lua') then
-            assert(loadstring(trusted))()
+            local chunk = assert(load(trusted, '@' .. file))
+            chunk()

comment_regular_data.body: Of course! how could I forget about that, sorry. I'll see if I can find a solution.

I think the solution for this problem is [`load()`](https://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-load), which has an optional chunk name of the string to be executed. Setting this chunkname to the filename ensures that `debug.getinfo(1, 'S')` can return the script name.

MWE:
1. Put the following in a `.nvim.lua` file in a parent directory (**not** current dir):
   ```lua
   local info = debug.getinfo(1, "S")
   local script_path = info.source:sub(2)
   local dir = script_path:match("(.*/)")
   print("My directory is:", dir)
   ```
4. `gh pr checkout 34638`
5. `make && VIMRUNTIME=./runtime ./build/bin/nvim --luamod-dev`
6. See `"My directory is: <full path to parent dir>"`

Again, this does not work yet for the exrc file in the current directory as it is handled in main.c. Furthermore, I'm not sure yet if this already worked for Vimscript files, probably not. If we were to also add support for vimscript files, maybe it would be better to include this in `vim.secure`? `vim.secure.execute()`?

> this does not work yet for the exrc file in the current directory 

what does it return in that case?

> as it is handled in main.c

what do you mean by this?

> what does it return in that case?

The old behaviour, `'<nvim>'`.

> what do you mean by this?

The code in `_defaults.lua` merely extends the 'exrc' functionality to searching exrc files in *parent directories* of the current directory. The 'exrc' functionality for the current directory is already handled in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/0b91e9f83b8807bf3fb584a70607deb1360824bd/src/nvim/main.c#L2057

The advantage of this is that if the user wants to revert to the old behaviour of only loading 'exrc' files found in the current directory, they simply disable the autocmd that searches the parent directories: `autocmd! nvim.exrc`. 

Of course I'm planning to also add the functionality to exrc files in the current directory, but my C and liblua knowledge is not that great, so it'll take me a bit more time to work on that.

How do I fix the lint CI? It shows the following:

```
FAIL: /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/lua/executor.c (File size changed from 65348 to 65365)
```

I get the same error locally. Any idea?

---

Other than that, I think this is ready for review. Should I update docs? E.g. mentioning `|debug.getinfo()|` at `|<script>|` or `'exrc'`?

> Should I update docs? E.g. mentioning `|debug.getinfo()|` at `|<script>|` or `'exrc'`?

yes
probably worth a 1-line assert in an existing exrc test

title: fix(exrc): exrc knows its own location
